title: WCAS FRENCH 121-3-21 Intermediate French
class_attributes:
Attendance at 1st class mandatory

Prerequisites apply, see description

descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value: French 121-3 is the last quarter of a three-quarter course for students who have completed French 121-2 or have been placed in that course by the French department. The aim of the course is to develop students' communication skills and cultural knowledge. Class meets four times a week. To fulfill the Weinberg College language requirement, Northwestern day school students may not P/N the course and must pass 121-3 with a minimum grade of C-.

descriptions.name: Registration Requirements
descriptions.value: French 121-2 or placed in the course by the French department.

descriptions.name: Learning Objectives
descriptions.value: The primary goal of this course is to develop students speaking, listening, reading and writing skills in a cultural context and to foster their critical thinking.

descriptions.name: Teaching Method
descriptions.value: Through study, exercises, conversation and various class activities, students will review and practice basic grammar, while exploring contemporary French and Francophone cultures. Class will be conducted in French. Students are expected to attend class daily, to actively participate and to spend at least 2 hours of work outside of class for each contact hour.

descriptions.name: Evaluation Method
descriptions.value: Class participation, homework & quizzes, four compositions, four lesson tests and one oral exam.
